feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
21/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Regular Expressions Without Fear – A list of great resources put together by Beverly Nelson
  • Local TLD – maintain a local development top level domain
  • Contrast Ratio Tool – Lea Verou’s Contrast/Ratio Tool
Alex:
  • PostgreSQL – PostgreSQL 9.4 Beta 1 Released
  • test against certain time – NEW Rails 4.1 travel_to test helper
  • admin_view – Rails 4 generator of CRUD admin interfaces for existing models.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
14/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-fifth edition:

Laura:
  • Euruject – For anyone who has ever felt rejected by Eurucamp ;)
  • Highlight – Code highlighting for Keynote presentations
  • Date/Time format cheatsheet – Get that date and time formatting syntax right, once and for all.
Alex:
  • Is TDD dead – Discussing about TDD with DHH, Kent Beck, and Martin Fowler.
  • Product Roadmap – How to define a Product Roadmap.
  • Ahoy – Simple, powerful analytics for Rails

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
07/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-fourth edition:

Laura:
  • Jeet – A grid system for humans
  • Coveralls – Track your code coverage over time
  • More Geopattern – Live demo of geopattern done with JavaScript
Tony:
  • When TDD doesn’t work. – Opinionated piece by Robert “Uncle Bob” Martin.
  • Jim Weirich on Decoupling from Rails – A brilliant mind talks neatly about a tough topic.
  • SelfTestingCode – Martin Fowler about a different approach (not TDD!).

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
30/04 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-third edition:

Laura:
  • Austria Hack Spots – A map of cool places to hack & work in Austria. Feel free to contribute!
  • Slippery – Make presentations with Markdown
  • GitHub Cheatsheet – Hidden and not-so-hidden features
Alex:
  • Design at Intercom – Decide what to build and how
  • Spotify engineering culture – Part 1 of a Podcast about Spotify’s engineering culture.
  • Bash Scripting – Tips and tricks about better bash scripting

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
23/04 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-second edition:

Laura:
  • Every line of code is always documented – a look at project history and what makes a good commit message
  • Geo_pattern – Create generative background images from a string
  • Hood.ie – Offline first: very fast web app development
Alex:
  • Shipping at GitHub – Shipping at the Speed of Life
  • Invoicing – Ruby Invoicing Framework
Tony:
  • Rails Assets – Bothered by bower and co? Use this.
  • New Google Maps Embed – Stuff just got easier.
  • PostgreSQL 9.4 Feature Highlight – Physical slots for replication. Pro stuff, very exciting.
